IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: FOUNDED IN 1865, PEIRCE COLLEGE IS A PRIVATE, FOUR-YEAR, SPECIALIZED INSTITUTION PROVIDING PRACTICAL, LEADING-EDGE CURRICULA TO PRIMARILY WORKING ADULT LEARNERS.
IRS990.MissionDescription: FOUNDED IN 1865, PEIRCE COLLEGE IS A PRIVATE, FOUR-YEAR, SPECIALIZED INSTITUTION PROVIDING PRACTICAL, LEADING-EDGE CURRICULA TO PRIMARILY WORKING ADULT LEARNERS. THE COLLEGE AWARDS THE BACHELOR OF SCIENCE AND ASSOCIATE IN SCIENCE DEGREES. THE DEGREE PROGRAMS ARE IN BUSINESS ADMINISTRATION, INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY AND LEGAL STUDIES.
IRS990.Description: FOUNDED IN 1865, PEIRCE COLLEGE IS A PRIVATE, FOUR-YEAR, SPECIALIZED INSTITUTION PROVIDING PRACTICAL LEADING-EDGE CURRICULA TO PRIMARILY WORKING ADULT LEARNERS. THE COLLEGE AWARDS THE BACHELOR OF SCIENCE AND ASSOCIATE IN SCIENCE DEGREES. THE DEGREE PROGRAMS ARE IN BUSINESS ADMINISTRATION, INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY AND LEGAL STUDIES. PEIRCE COLLEGE OFFERS ITS PROGRAMS UTILIZING THREE INTERCHANGEABLE DELIVERY FORMATS: ON CAMPUS AT ITs CENTER CITY PHILADELPHIA LOCATION, ON SITE AT CORPORATE AND COMMUNITY SITES THROUGHOUT THE REGION; AND ONLINE THROUGH WEB BASED DISTANCE LEARNING. PEIRCE COLLEGE IS ACCREDITED BY THE MIDDLE STATES COMMISSION ON HIGHER EDUCATION. THE BACHELOR OF SCIENCE AND ASSOCIATE IN SCIENCE DEGREES AND THE CERTIFICATE OF PROFICIENCY IN PARALEGAL STUDIES ARE RECOGNIZED AND APPROVED BY THE AMERICAN BAR ASSOCIATION (ABA). THE ACCREDITATION COUNCIL FOR BUSINESS SCHOOLS AND PROGRAMS (ACBSP) ACCREDITS PEIRCE COLLEGE'S BACHELOR OF SCIENCE AND ASSOCIATE IN SCIENCE DEGREES AND CERTIFICATES OF PROFICIENCY IN BUSINESS ADMINISTRATION.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: ENDOWMENT FUNDS ARE RESTRICTED FOR SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Identifier: ORGANIZATION'S LIABILITY FOR UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS UNDER FIN 48
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: SCHEDULE D, PART X, OTHER LIABILITIES
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: In December 2008, the FASB issued guidance concerning uncertain tax positions for nonpublic entities. The College adopted this guidance. The College evaluates its uncertain tax positions as it evaluates loss contingencies. A loss contingency is recognized when it is probable that a liability has been incurred as of the date of the financial statements and the amount of the loss can be reasonably estimated. The amount recognized is subject to estimate and management judgment with respect to the likely outcome of each uncertain tax position. The amount that is ultimately sustained for an individual uncertain tax position or for all uncertain tax positions in the aggregate could differ from the amount recognized. The college has no uncertain tax positions within the financial statements.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Identifier: OTHER AMOUNT APPEARING IN RECONCILIATION OF REVENUE
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE AMOUNT APPEARING ON LINE 4B OF THE RECONCILIATION OF REVENUE PER AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS WITH REVENUE PER RETURN IS COMPRISED OF: SCHOLARSHIPS/AWARDS: $1,056,943 PELL/SMART/ACG/SEOG/PHEAA GRANTS: $6,019,645 ----------- Total: $7,076,588

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Identifier: OTHER AMOUNT APPEARING IN RECONCILIATION OF EXPENSES
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE AMOUNT APPEARING ON LINE 4B OF THE RECONCILIATION OF EXPENSES PER AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS WITH EXPENSES PER RETURN IS COMPRISED OF: SCHOLARSHIPS/AWARDS: $1,056,943 PELL/SMART/ACG/SEOG/PHEAA GRANTS: $6,019,645 ----------- Total: $7,076,588

IRS990ScheduleE.PubViaBroadcastMediaExpln: PEIRCE COLLEGE GIVES SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS TO STUDENTS BASED UPON FINANCIAL NEED AND ACADEMIC EXCELLENCE. THE SELECTION OF RECIPIENTS IS MADE BASED UPON OBJECIVE CRITERIA. NO ONE IS DISCRIMINATED AGAINST BASED UPON RACE, RELIGION, GENDER, ETHNIC BACKGROUND, AGE, HANDICAP, STATUS AS A DISABLED VETERAN, OR ANY OTHER REASON.
IRS990ScheduleE.GovtFinancialAidExplanation: PEIRCE COLLEGE RECEIVED ASSISTANCE FROM THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION FOR THE FOLLOWING PROGRAMS: FEDERAL PELL GRANT, FEDERAL SUPPLEMENTAL EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITY GRANT, FEDERAL WORK STUDY, FEDERAL ACADEMIC COMPETITIVENESS GRANT, NATIONAL SCIENCE AND MATHEMATICS ACCESS TO RETAIN TALENT GRANT, TRIO-STUDENT SUPPORT SERVICES GRANT, AND THE CARL D. PERKINS CAREER AND TECHNICAL EDUCATION GRANT. PEIRCE COLLEGE ALSO RECEIVED INSTITUTIONAL ASSISTANCE GRANT AND PENNSYLVANIA STATE GRANT FROM THE PENNSYLVANIA HIGHER EDUCATION ASSISTANCE AGENCY.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: DESCRIPTION FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE UNITED STATES
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: ALL STUDENT FINANCIAL AID GRANTS ARE USED FOR THE INTENDED PURPOSE WHICH IS TO PROVIDE AID TO STUDENTS WITH A NEED IN EXCESS OF THEIR TUITION COSTS. THESE GRANTS INCLUDE FEDERAL PELL GRANTS, STATE PHEAA GRANTS, FEDERAL SEOG GRANTS, FEDERAL ACG GRANTS, AND FEDERAL SMART GRANTS. THE COLLEGE ALSO AWARDS DONOR RESTRICTED GRANTS THAT ARE PROVIDED FROM FOUNDATIONS, ALUMNI SCHOLARSHIP DONATIONS, AND OTHER DONORS. ADDITIONALY, THE COLLEGE PROVIDES INTERNAL INSTITUTIONAL GRANTS SUCH AS LEADERSHIP AWARDS, ETC. THESE GRANTS ARE AWARDED BY THE OFFICE OF STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES (FINANCIAL AID OFFICE) AND POSTED TO THE ELIGIBLE STUDENT'S ACCOUNTS BY THE BUSINESS OFFICE. THESE ACCOUNTS ARE RECONCILED BY THE BUSINESS OFFICE AND FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AT LEAST MONTHLY. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE COMPLIES WITH THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION GUIDELINES AND THE PENNSYLVANIA HIGHER EDUCATION ASSISTANCE AGENCY (PHEAA) GUIDELINES AS WELL AS ANY DONOR RESTRICTED GRANT GUIDELINES. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE REPORTS STUDENT GRANT AWARDS TO THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION AND PHEAA THROUGHOUT THE YEAR AND ALSO SUBMITS THE REQUIRED ANNUAL FISAP REPORT TO THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION. AN ANNUAL A-133 AUDIT (FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND REPORT OF INDEPENDENT CERTIFIED PUBLIC ACCOUNTANTS IN ACCORDANCE WITH OMB CIRCULAR A-133) IS CONDUCTED BY THE COLLEGE'S EXTERNAL INDEPENDENT AUDITORS.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: FORMERLY, THE COLLEGE PROVIDED OFF-CAMPUS HOUSING FOR ONLY THE PRESIDENT (WHO WAS UNDER CONtRACT) OF THE COLLEGE FOR BOTH PERSONAL AND BUSINESS USE. THIS BENEFIT WAS A TAXABLE BENEFIT AND TAXED ACCORDINGLY THROUGH THE PAYROLL IN PRIOR YEARS. SUBSTANTIATION FOR THE HOUSING EXPENSES WERE DOCUMENTED AND MAINTAINED BY THE COLLEGE. THESE EXPENSES INCLUDED RENT AND UTILITIES. AS A RESULT OF THE PRESIDENT'S RETIREMENT EFFECTIVE JUNE 30, 2009, THIS CONTRACT WAS NOT RENEWED. DURING THE CURRENT TAX YEAR, THE COLLEGE DID NOT PROVIDE THIS BENEFIT.

The following represent amounts that were accrued to these individuals: James J. Mergiotti, President & CEO $39,566 Patricia A. Rucker, SVP & Provost $12,022 James M. Vitale, SVP Finance & Administration $11,794

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Form 990 was prepared by a nationally renowned accounting firm in conjunction with the organization's financial department. THE FORM IS THEN SUBMITTED TO THE FINANCE, AUDIT & FACILITIES MANAGEMENT COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD FOR APPROVAL. A copy of the draft Form 990 IS THEN circulated to the full Board of Trustees for discussion and comment. Each Board Member was provided ample opportunity to comment on the information contained in the 990 prior to its filing with the Internal Revenue Service.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, QUESTION 12C
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE COLLEGE REQUIRES EACH EMPLOYEE INCLUDING THE PRESIDENT/CEO AND OTHER KEY EMPLOYEES TO COMPLETE AND SIGN A WRITTEN CONFLICTS OF INTEREST STATEMENT THAT INCLUDES QUESTIONS THAT CAN DETERMINE IF THE EMPLOYEE HAS A RELATIONSHIP, FINANCIAL INTEREST OR BUSINESS AFFILIATION THAT RESULTS IN A CONFLICT OF INTEREST. THESE STATEMENTS ARE COMPLETED ANNUALLY BY THE EMPLOYEE AND AT ANY TIME AN EMPLOYEE BECOMES AWARE OF FACTS WHICH REQUIRE AN ADDITIONAL OR UPDATED DISCLOSURE. THESE STATEMENTS ARE RETURNED TO HUMAN RESOURCES FOR REVIEW AND IF NECESSARY FURTHER ACTION MAY BE REQUIRED. THE COLLEGE ALSO REQUIRES EACH TRUSTEE INCLUDING TRUSTEE OFFICERS TO COMPLETE AND SIGN A CONFLICT OF INTEREST QUESTIONNAIRE THAT CAN DETERMINE IF THE TRUSTEE HAS A RELATIONSHIP, FINANCIAL INTEREST OR BUSINESS AFFILIATION THAT RESULTS IN A CONFLICT OF INTEREST. THESE QUESTIONNAIRES ARE COMPLETED ANNUALLY BY EACH TRUSTEE AND RETURNED TO THE BOARD SECRETARY AND ARE REVIEWED BY THE OFFICE OF THE PRESIDENT AND IF NECESSARY FURTHER ACTION MAY BE REQUIRED.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, QUESTION 15A & B
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE COMPENSATION FOR THE PRESIDENT OF PEIRCE COLLEGE WAS BASED ON WORK DONE BY AN OUTSIDE CONSULTING FIRM COMMISSIONED BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. THE COMPENSATION DATA WAS COMPILED USING INFORMATION FROM OTHER COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES AS A GUIDE IN DETERMINING THE COMPENSATION OF THE PRESIDENT. THE COMPENSATION FOR THE KEY EMPLOYEES OF PEIRCE COLLEGE WAS DETERMINED BY LOCAL AND REGIONAL MARKET SURVEYS AND INFORMATION AND DATA FROM LOCAL AND REGIONAL PUBLICATIONS AND PAPERS. THIS INFORMATION, ALONG WITH INTERNAL EQUITY, DETERMINED THE BASIS HIRE-IN SALARY OF KEY EMPLOYEES. ANNUALLY, KEY EMPLOYEES ARE EVALUATED BY THE PRESIDENT USING A PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT PLAN (PDP) WHICH IS A STANDARD REVIEW USED BY ALL MANAGERS AND SUPERVISORS THROUGHOUT THE COLLEGE. THE PDP FOR EACH KEY EMPLOYEE IS ALSO REVIEWED BY HUMAN RESOURCES TO ENSURE EQUITY WITHIN THE COLLEGE. THIS PROCESS ALSO DETERMINES THE PERCENT OF MERIT INCREASES RECEIVED. THE MERIT INCREASE PERCENTAGES ARE DETERMINED AS PART OF THE BUDGET PROCESS AND THE LEVEL OF PERCENTAGE INCREASES GIVEN TO THE KEY EMPLOYEES IS BASED ON THE SCORING OUTCOME OF THEIR PDP. ONCE THE MERIT INCREASES FOR THE KEY EMPLOYEES ARE DETERMINED, THEY ARE PRESENTED TO, AND APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, QUESTION 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The College makes its Form 990 available to the public by retaining a copy at its place of business. The Form 990 is likewise published on the internet at www.guidestar.org. The organization's governing documents and conflict of interest policy are not ordinarily made available to the public, but, if requested, will be provided at management's discretion. THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC ON WWW.DNB.COM.
